content.description:
Quid ille1fecerit, quem neque pudetneque pudet = “nothing shames”, 
quicquam nec metuit, quemquam neque legem putat 
tenere se ullam?
 1:The subject of metuit and putat is ille.↩
content.question: According to the sentence, the speaker suggests that the man in line 1 (ille) has done something that

choices.label: he has been afraid to do
got him in trouble with the law

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
